channel.title: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux

item.title: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:36, topic:293034”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=387182.msg3001505#msg3001505 date=1256036403]

because that is so intuitive…

its plenty intuitive… its a package… its central to the idea of the os.

if youd never used windows before, going to some random website, finding the .msi, and double clicking that wouldnt be intuitive either :rolleyes:
[/quote]
it would come with the part/computer on the cd…[/quote]And how is that linux’s fault?

Read full topic

item.source: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux

item.title: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:293034”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=387182.msg2999852#msg2999852 date=1255891406]
Does Linux have out-f-the-box support for Broadcom wireless network cards? oh wait.
[/quote]

Yes, the b43 driver works perfectly. You do have to download proprietary firmware that, by law, can’t be shipped with the linux distros, but it comes with the free and open source driver.

Does windows (or mac either) have out of the box support for broadcom wireless network cards? No, you have to download the firmware and drivers that can’t legally be shipped with the operating systems.

So your point was?..[/quote]
On a slightly relative note, let’s compare the number of steps required to get this proprietary firmware that, by law, can’t be shipped with linux or windows working on linux or windows…

Read full topic
item.source: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux

item.title: Today's XKCD nicely sums up everything that's shit about linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Pwnd:

Does Linux have out-f-the-box support for Broadcom wireless network cards? oh wait.

Yes, the b43 driver works perfectly. You do have to download proprietary firmware that, by law, can’t be shipped with the linux distros, but it comes with the free and open source driver.

Does windows (or mac either) have out of the box support for broadcom wireless network cards? No, you have to download the firmware and drivers that can’t legally be shipped with the operating systems.

So your point was?..

Read full topic
